title: recover
extract: (of a person) to regain (health, spirits, composure, etc), as after illness, a setback, or a shock, etc. to regain (a former and usually better condition) industry recovered after the war. law. (tr)to gain (something) by the judgment of a court of law to recover damages.
extract_html: (of a person) to regain (health, spirits, composure, etc), as after illness, a setback, or a shock, etc. to regain (a former and usually better condition) industry recovered after the war. law. (tr)to gain (something) by the judgment of a court of law to recover damages.
